New Records: Georgia earned their first ever point at a major international tournament.
Georges Mikautadze scored the latest first-half goal in European Championship history (48:20).
Patrik Schick became Czech Republic’s leading scorer at the European Championship with six goals.
Giorgi Mamardashvili made 11 saves, the second-most in a game at the European Championship since 1980.
Key Match Events: Giorgi Mamardashvili made eight saves by half-time.
Georges Mikautadze scored a penalty in first-half injury time.
Patrik Schick scored the equaliser for Czech Republic.
Patrik Schick limped off with an injury in the second half.
Saba Lobjanidze missed a golden chance to win the game for Georgia with the last kick of the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Czech Republic had 27 shots, 12 on target, and an xG of 3.1.
Czech Republic attempted 46 crosses, with only nine successful.
Nine yellow cards were handed out in the game, the most in a match at the UEFA European Championship since 2016.
